    • Constructor Detail

      • FileStorage

        public FileStorage(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a FileStorage. It allows you to store
        your serializable object in a file using a key
        for identification and to read it somewhen later.
        Parameters:
        file - The file your data shall be stored in
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if your File cannot be created
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if your File is a directory

    • Method Detail

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.Object o)
        Stores an Object o using a String key for later identification
        Use store(String key, Object o, String password) for storing using AES encryption.
        Parameters:
        key - The key as String.
        o - The Object.

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.Object o,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Stores an Object o using a String key for later identification
        and a password for AES encryption.

        Use store(String key, Object o) for storing without encryption.
        Parameters:
        key - The key as String.
        o - The Object.
        password - The Password.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
        Reads your object from the storage.

        Use get(String key, String password) for AES encrypted objects.
        Parameters:
        key - The key the object is available under
        Returns:
        your Object or null if nothing was found for key

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String password)
                     throws Crypter.DecryptionFailedException
        Reads your AES encrypted object from the storage.

        Use get(String key) instead for unencrypted objects.
        Parameters:
        key - The key the object is available under
        password - The password to use for decryption
        Returns:
        your object or null if nothing was found for key or if decryption failed (wrong password)
        Throws:
        Crypter.DecryptionFailedException - This usually happens if the password is wrong
